content: pick up the same number as on the other side k remaining 10 sts to centre back round1 k to 2 sts before marker ssk slip marker work instep as charted slip second marker k2 decrease k to end of round round2 k to marker slip marker work instep as charted slip second marker k to end of round repeat these two rounds until you have decreased your stitch count back to 72 sts or whatever number will be best suited to your foot size on my sample i have actually decreased down to 68 sts so i had 32 sts on the sole and 36 sts on the instep take a note of your number this will be important for working the toe later foot you may notice that on the foot the pattern doesn t just twist in one direction but it rather mean- ders from left to right gently this is achieved by changing between version a and version b when ever there is a change of direction i have inserted what i call a spacer row these are row 33 and row 66 on the instep charts work the foot without decreases as per round 2 instructions until you are 5 cm / 2 inches short of your desired total foot length for the bigger sizes once you have finished row 66 of the instep chart start again with row 1 however take care that you finish after a full pattern section these points are marked with a blue line in the chart if your foot length would fall somewhere between two lines work to the line and then work spacer rounds until you have the required length spacer round k to instep marker work instep by k tbl the k sts and p the p sts and the yo s k to end of round wendel page 4 toe the instructions for the toe sound very wordy but the principle should be quite simple on the in- step you will decrease all the purl sts first so the k tbl columns will form a solid block depending on where you ended the foot there are a few variables hence why it may sound more complicated than it really is try and visualise what you are supposed to be doing and it should work if you have worked your foot with an unequal number of sts on sole and instep you will need to get these numbers to even out in my example i had 32 sole and 36 instep sts so i had to decrease 4 sts on the instep to avoid a sudden decrease in numbers i decided to decrease an extra 2 sts within the first 2 decrease row but if that sounds too complicated you could work one spacer round where you work all necessary decreases and then work the toe as directed assuming you have the same number of sts on sole and instep work the toe as follows round1 k
